page.title: 16NEW HOSPITAL B'MOUTH
page.content: The new hospital will be situated close to the junction of A338(London to Bournemouth) and A3060 (Christchurch to Wimborne) roads. It will be built in two phases and the total cost, minus equipment, will be about Â£41,000,000. There will be about 290 doctors, 2900 nurses and over 2500 other people employed there. To accomodate the staff a small village will be built next to the hospital with about 230 houses, each with 6 bedsitting rooms including kitchens and bathrooms. It should be open in 1990, but some patients will enter in late 1987. The Royal National Hospital will give 74 patients to the hospital and will close down. Boscombe Hospital will give all its patients to the new hospital, also closing. Christchurch Hospital will give 57 patients to the General but will remain open with 307.
